question: Some people at the time of going to bed recite Ayat-ul-Kursi and clap 3 times. There theory is that, this secures the area as far as the sound of the clap reaches. Is this based on Hadith?
answer:
QUESTION
Some other people imagine the area that is to be safeguarded and go around it visually by their index finger while reciting Ayat-ul-Kursi? Is this the correct way either?
ANSWER


Share:
The recitation of Aayaatul Kursi is indeed virtuous and beneficial and is%0D%0Aproven from the Ahaadith.%0D%0A%0D%0AUbayy ibn Ka'ab (Radhiallaahu Anhu) narrates that Rasulullah (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam) once asked him, 'O Abu Munzhir, do you know which Aayat%0D%0Afrom the Qur'aan that you have is the greatest?' I said, 'Allah and His%0D%0Amessenger knows best.' Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) then asked again,%0D%0AI said, 'Allaahu laa ilaaha illaa huwal hayyul qayyoom . i.e. Aayatul Kursi.%0D%0A' He says that then Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) hit my chest and%0D%0Asaid, 'May your knowledge benefit you O Abu Munzhir.' (Mishkaat pg.185)%0D%0A%0D%0AIn another lengthy Hadith, it is mentioned that when a person recites%0D%0AAayaatul Kursi, when he goes to sleep then Allah Ta'ala appoints a protector%0D%0Afor him and Shaytaan doesn't come close to him until the morning .'%0D%0A(Mishkaat)%0D%0A%0D%0AHowever, the actions mentioned by you are not proven from Hadith but are%0D%0Arather based on experiences and prescriptions of learned scholars.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0Afor: Mufti Ebrahim Desai%0D%0AFATWA DEPT.%0D%0A%0D%0ACHECKED AND APPROVED: Moulana Imraan Vawda
